section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section provides hands-on practice with Python variables and core data types. Students will learn to declare variables, work with integers, floats, strings, booleans, and None values, perform type conversions, and debug common data type issues through structured coding exercises.
learning_objectives: Declare variables using Python syntax and assign appropriate values
Identify and utilize core Python data types including int, float, str, bool, and None
Convert between data types using type conversion functions
Debug code errors related to incorrect data type usage
Apply best practices for variable naming and type inference

lessons.lesson_title: Declaring Variables and Basic Data Types
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare variables and assign integer, float, string, and boolean values correctly

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables of each basic data type (int, float, str, bool) and use the type() function to verify their data types
Perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division operations with integers and floats, storing results in new variables

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will demonstrate understanding of Python's dynamic typing behavior by predicting and verifying variable types

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a variable, assign it a string value, then reassign it to a boolean. Use type checks to document the type changes
Write a program that assigns various operations to variables and predict the resulting data types before running the code

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will successfully convert between data types using int(), float(), str(), and bool() functions

exercises.exercise_instructions: Write a program that takes user input as a string and converts it to integer and float types, handling potential errors
Convert a float to integer, a string to boolean, and a boolean to string while documenting the output values

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will implement programs that demonstrate proper usage of None and Python literals

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a function that returns None under specific conditions and handles this return value appropriately in the calling code
Write code to determine the data types of various literals including 0, 0.0, '0', and False

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will identify and resolve data type-related errors in provided code samples

exercises.exercise_instructions: Analyze a code sample with intentional type errors and modify it to execute without errors
Debug a program where type conversions produce incorrect results by implementing proper casting
